com.room4me.xml
Class TagNode

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.room4me.xml.Node
        |
        +--com.room4me.xml.TagNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class TagNode
extends Node

This class represents a simple XML tag (also known as an "element") node. It has several constructors, one of which does not parse the attribute list until an attribute is requested. The "lazy" evaluation of attributes can give faster performance.

Author:
Frank Font (mrfont@room4me.com)
See Also:
SmallXMLParser

Constructor Summary
TagNode(java.lang.String sName, java.lang.String sAttribs)
          Creates a node with the specified name and attribute text.
TagNode(java.lang.String sName, java.lang.String sAttribs, boolean bLazyAttribParse)
          Creates a node with the specified name and attribute text but does not parse the attribute list until needed if it is used in "lazy" mode.

          Get the attribute by name if it exists.

Constructor Detail

TagNode

public TagNode(java.lang.String sName,
               java.lang.String sAttribs)
        throws MalformedXMLException
Creates a node with the specified name and attribute text.
Parameters:
sName - Name of this node. e.g., For XML tag <a b='x' c='y'> the name is "a".
sAttribs - The text of the attribute list. For above example, that would be "b='x' c='y'".
Throws:
MalformedXMLException - when attribute syntax is bad.

TagNode

public TagNode(java.lang.String sName,
               java.lang.String sAttribs,
               boolean bLazyAttribParse)
        throws MalformedXMLException
Creates a node with the specified name and attribute text but does not parse the attribute list until needed if it is used in "lazy" mode.
Parameters:
sName - Name of this node. e.g., For XML tag <a b='x' c='y'> the name is "a".
sAttribs - The text of the attribute list. For above example, that would be "b='x' c='y'".
bLazyAttribParse - If true, then attribute list is not parsed until needed.
Throws:
MalformedXMLException - if attribute syntax is bad and bLazyAttribParse=false.
Method Detail

getAttributes

public java.util.ArrayList getAttributes()
Returns attributes as ArrayList of Attribute objects.
Returns:
The attributes as list of Attribute objects.
See Also:
Attribute

findAttribute

public Attribute findAttribute(java.lang.String sName)
Get the attribute by name if it exists.
Parameters:
sName - Name of attribute to find.
Returns:
If found this is instance of matching attribute, else null.

getAttributesAsText

public java.lang.String getAttributesAsText()
Returns attribute list as as text in a String object.
Returns:
The attribute list as text.
